data.title: Gripping drama and impactful docs dominate BBC NI's autumn
data.description: BBC Northern Ireland announces its upcoming season of new commissions.

data.title: Star looks back at Welsh rugby film Grand Slam
data.description: Watch Grand Slam's Dewi Morris reflect on the film, 40 years after its release.

data.title: The Traitors: First UK celebrity series announced
data.description: A fourth series for members of the public has been commissioned, with a third already filmed.

data.title: Film studio pulls Megalopolis trailer over fake quotes
data.description: The trailer for Francis Ford Coppola's fantasy epic included fabricated quotes about the filmmaker.

data.title: Transmitter problems lead to local TV woes
data.description: A technical fault with Freeview transmitters in the Kendal area has been affecting services.

data.title: BBC sacks presenter Jermaine Jenas after complaints
data.description: The ex-footballer says there are "two sides to every story" after he is taken off air by the BBC.

data.title: How Ed Jackson went from spinal injury to mountain climbing
data.description: A new documentary follows the former rugby player after he broke his neck in a swimming accident in 2017.

data.title: Carol Vorderman says TV industry is 'a mess'
data.description: The former Countdown presenter delivered a speech at the Edinburgh TV Festival on Friday.

data.title: Jenas 'speaking to lawyers' after BBC sacking
data.description: The Match of the Day and One Show star was fired over allegations of sending unsolicited messages.

data.title: 'That little devil is filming': Director's time with the Taliban
data.description: Ibrahim Nash’at succeeded in getting permission to film with the Taliban for a year.

data.title: Cate Blanchett to return to stage after six years
data.description: The actress will star in Chekhov's The Seagull, which will also feature Strike actor Tom Burke.

data.title: Punk, pop and pioneers: New film looks at Scotland's female bands
data.description: Since Yesterday will receive its world premiere as the closing gala at the Edinburgh International Film Festival.

data.title: Why there's anger at Alien: Romulus's shock cameo
data.description: The new Alien film has enraged many with the re-appearance of an actor from the 1979 original – brought back from the dead using digital trickery. Is such anger justified?

data.title: It Ends With Us star says female cast 'vilified'
data.description: Brandon Sklenar, who stars alongside Blake Lively, says the film's reception has been "disheartening".

data.title: Blink Twice review: 'Stylish and savage' ★★★☆☆
data.description: Zoe Kravitz's directorial debut is full of "smart ideas, contentious themes, cool images and striking sequences" – but does it work as a compelling thriller?

data.title: Writer calls for more working-class people in UK TV
data.description: He says class should be considered as a diversity metric as much as other forms of representation.

data.title: Michaela Coel reveals first TV show for four years
data.description: The 36-year-old will follow up her award-winning drama I May Destroy You with First Day On Earth.

data.title: Talk show host Phil Donahue dies aged 88
data.description: Across a career spanning several decades, Donahue was considered the "king of daytime talk".

data.title: Ayling-Ellis 'excited' to make history as TV host
data.description: The former Strictly winner will become the first deaf person to host live sports coverage on TV.

data.title: Indie film festival enjoys record-breaking year
data.description: More than 2,000 movie fans gather to watch some of the country's best new independent films.

data.title: Mr Bates vs the Post Office and Baby Reindeer nominated for NTAs
data.description: The winners will be announced at a ceremony at London's O2 Arena on 11 September.

data.title: French film giant Alain Delon dies aged 88
data.description: Brigitte Bardot says Delon's death has left a "huge void that nothing and no-one will be able to fill".

data.title: Ofcom rejects 3,600 Love Island complaints
data.description: The TV watchdog decides not to investigate the complaints, which it says involved bullying and racism.

data.title: Molly-Mae, Tommy Fury and the 'brutal' Love Island bubble
data.description: When all your relationship firsts are broadcast to millions, are you doomed to fail before you start?

data.title: Indiana Jones's Temple of Doom hat sells for $630k
data.description: Harrison Ford is seen wearing the fedora while leaping from a plane in the 1984 film.

data.title: 'I was terrified' - Saoirse Ronan learns lambing for The Outrun
data.description: Based on Amy Liptrot’s award winning memoir, the film is about a young woman returning to Orkney to deal with her past.

data.title: City map of Outlaws filming locations launched
data.description: Actor Stephen Merchant says it is important the whole of Bristol "feels part of the Outlaws story".

data.title: Film nerd mates create comedy love letter to valleys
data.description: Animated series The Golden Cobra is written by three friends and set in a small Welsh valleys town.

data.title: How Alain Delon's family was torn apart in tragic finale
data.description: Old feuds and past rivalries re-emerged in public as ailing cinematic great's children fought for his legacy.

data.title: Star 'devastated' to miss scenes with Anthony Hopkins
data.description: Iwan Rheon was "kind of joking, but wasn't" when he pleaded for scenes with Anthony Hopkins.

data.title: Gavin and Stacey set to begin filming in Barry Island
data.description: Co-creator James Corden says he's off to Barry Island for seven weeks after finishing a London play.

data.title: The Notebook actress Gena Rowlands dies at 94
data.description: The Hollywood legend has been racking up acting awards since the 1950s.

data.title: 'Ketamine Queen' and cover-ups: What we learned from the Matthew Perry investigation
data.description: An investigation into the Friends actor's death uncovered an alleged vast ketamine dealing network.

data.title: Mayor aims to make Hollywood of the North a reality
data.description: If approved, the film studios will be delivered in phases and a total of £17m has so far been committed.

data.title: Could K-pop trained British band be the new One Direction?
data.description: New BBC show sees British boy band hopefuls Dear Alice put through rigorous K-pop training in Seoul.

data.title: Timeline: How the Huw Edwards scandal unfolded
data.description: The former BBC broadcaster's crimes and other allegations against him date back four years.

data.title: Is the BBC realistic to ask Huw Edwards to return his pay?
data.description: BBC appears to be relying on ex-presenter to do the right thing, says Media editor Katie Razzall.

data.title: Disney unveils Avatar 3's official title and new films
data.description: Details of new films including the third Avatar and a new Star Wars are announced at a Disney fan event.

data.title: Drugged and kidnapped model says people still call her a liar years on
data.description: Chloe Ayling tells the BBC how she dealt with victim blaming, online trolls and telling her story again.

data.title: Eurovision star: There never was a case against me
data.description: The singer was disqualified from the contest in May, after an alleged altercation with a camerawoman.

data.title: MTV delays VMAs to avoid clash with US debate
data.description: The Video Music Awards had been scheduled to take place on 10 September, but will now be a day later.

data.title: Kym Marsh says she has 'fond memories' of Strictly
data.description: The actress indicats she was surprised by allegations about her former dance partner Graziano Di Prima.

data.title: Weather presenter speaks out about on-air panic attack
data.description: ABC News Breakfast's Nate Byrne speaks with the BBC about how he handled the on-air moment.

data.title: Disney star arrested at theme park over 'domestic incident'
data.description: Skai Jackson, known for her role as Zuri Ross in the sitcom Jessie, was held at Universal Studios.

data.title: 'Naked Video' actor and director Ron Bain dies aged 79
data.description: The actor was known for his work with Rikki Fulton and Gregor Fisher and as a director of TV comedies.

data.title: West Belfast premiere for 'fun and serious' Kneecap film
data.description: The film tells a fictionalised version of Kneecap's origin story and the Irish language.

data.title: Black Panther actress Connie Chiume dies aged 72
data.description: The multi-award-winning actress starred in several South African TV shows and became a household name.

data.title: Rare Transformers toys are helping children in poverty
data.description: Since starting in 2009, the Toy-Fu group has earned an estimated £178,000 for the charity Mary's Meals.

data.title: Daisy Ridley reveals Graves' disease diagnosis
data.description: The Star Wars actress initially put the symptoms down to the effects of making a stressful film.

data.title: Good Morning Britain show prompts 8,200 complaints
data.description: Media regulator Ofcom is assessing two controversial interviews on Monday's episode of the ITV show.

data.title: Gemma Collins advert for depression headset banned
data.description: The advertising watchdog rules that an ad posted by the TV personality on Instagram broke its rules.

data.title: The 'absurd' real-life sting operation that inspired a movie
data.description: Trap, from director M. Night Shyamalan, is inspired by an extraordinary real-life sting called Operation Flagship in 1985.

data.title: Blake Lively: My domestic abuse film is tragic and inspiring
data.description: The film is based on the best-selling book by Colleen Hoover that took TikTok by storm in 2022.
